message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with template matching, which is a core problem in computer vision. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a trainable layer that can be embedded into deep neural networks, indicating a focus on deep learning, which suggests cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the second most likely sub-category. The paper also uses soft-ranking to assess the quality of matching pairs, which involves a degree of decision-making and could be considered an AI-related technique, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also evaluates its method on classic template matching benchmarks and deep learning tasks, indicating a focus on multimedia and information retrieval, making cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) possible sub-categories.
